name: Annie Duke
background: Former professional poker player, decision strategist. Won World Series of Poker bracelet. Wrote 'Thinking in Bets' and 'Quit'. Applies poker thinking to business decisions.

principles.name: Think in bets, not binary outcomes
principles.description: Every decision is a bet on an uncertain future. Express confidence as probabilities. Good decisions can have bad outcomes and vice versa. Judge decisions by process, not results.
principles.falsification: When outcomes do genuinely reflect decision quality and luck is minimal

principles.name: Resulting is a cognitive trap
principles.description: Don't judge decision quality by outcome alone. A good process with bad luck looks like a bad decision. A bad process with good luck looks smart. Separate luck from skill.
principles.falsification: When repeated outcomes strongly signal decision quality despite variance

principles.name: Quit strategically, not emotionally
principles.description: Knowing when to quit is as important as persistence. Sunk costs are irrelevant. Set kill criteria before starting. Grit without quitting criteria is just stubbornness.
principles.falsification: When persistence through difficulty genuinely leads to breakthrough success
